title: Depth-First Search (DFS)
description: A fundamental graph and tree traversal algorithm that explores as far as possible along each branch before backtracking. It's one of the most important algorithms in computer science, used in a wide variety of applications.
demoDescription: In the interactive demo, you'll see DFS in action as it builds parent-child relationships in a permission tree structure, demonstrating how the algorithm traverses hierarchical data structures.

characteristics.title: Deep Exploration
characteristics.description: Explores nodes by going deep before going wide, following one path to its end before backtracking

characteristics.title: Stack-Based
characteristics.description: Uses a stack (or recursion) to keep track of nodes to visit, making it memory efficient for deep trees

characteristics.title: Time Complexity
characteristics.description: O(V + E) where V is vertices and E is edges - visits each node and edge exactly once

characteristics.title: Space Complexity
characteristics.description: O(V) for the recursion stack or explicit stack - space needed is proportional to the depth of the tree

useCases.title: Tree/Graph Traversal
useCases.description: Visiting all nodes in a tree or graph structure systematically

useCases.title: Path Finding
useCases.description: Finding paths between nodes in a graph, useful for navigation and routing

useCases.title: Cycle Detection
useCases.description: Detecting cycles in graphs, essential for validating graph structures

useCases.title: Topological Sorting
useCases.description: Ordering nodes in a directed acyclic graph, used in dependency resolution

useCases.title: Tree Operations
useCases.description: Building parent maps, finding ancestors, and validating tree structures

useCases.title: Backtracking Algorithms
useCases.description: Solving puzzles, generating permutations, and exploring solution spaces

demo.title: Interactive DFS Demo
demo.description: Explore a real-world implementation of DFS in a role permissions tree debugger. Click through the interactive demo to see how DFS traverses tree structures and maintains parent-child relationships.
